directions: Soak the soybeans in water overnight.
Drain and rinse the soybeans thoroughly.
Puree the soybeans with water in a blender until smooth.
Strain the puree through a cheesecloth or fine mesh sieve to remove solids.
Transfer the strained liquid to a large container.
Add hexane to the liquid and stir well.
Let the mixture sit for 30 minutes to allow the hexane to separate the lecithin from other components.
Carefully decant the top layer, which contains the lecithin, into a separate container.
Store the soy lecithin in an airtight container in the refrigerator.
Use as a natural emulsifier and stabilizer in various recipes.
